definitions.definition: That conforms , especially to the shape of something.
That preserves angles between intersecting curves .
That preserves relative angles over small scales, at all but a limited number of distinct points.
examples: On conformal map projections, the scale depends on location only and not direction.

main_definition: That conforms , especially to the shape of something.
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics , of a transformation ) That preserves angles between intersecting curves .
( cartography , of a map projection ) That preserves relative angles over small scales, at all but a limited number of distinct points.
